instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 running slow
threads.message: fix a customers 00165 board they are complaining it is running slow and they say the fan starts off slow but slowly increase to full speed. what could cause it to run slow? i honestly didn't notice it running slow so not sure if its actually a problem or if the customer is just being fussy.  i told them to do an smc reset but they said it made no difference.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 running slow
threads.message: Sensor issue of course, the most common is trackpad........  Hold "D" on startup to run diagnostic.....

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 running slow
threads.message: activity monitor shows the cpu is running at full..

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 running slow
threads.message: Did you run diagnostic????? also could be a bad battery....

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 running slow
threads.message: i dont have the board the customer does, i told them to run diagnostics they said they did and that the cpu is running at full i'm not sure why they didn't tell me how diagnostics went..  this was a mail in repair so i will have to wait to get it back.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 running slow
threads.message: Make sure they're not using a chinese charger, too. Trackpad, trackpad cable, IO cable, battery. Check them all.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 running slow
threads.message: diagnostic gave smc PFM006, firmware PFR001, Additional's NDC001, PPN001, VDH002.  Also to note i did Not have a battery connected in case any codes relate to that.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 running slow
threads.message: reflowed the smc and all the errors went away. fans running normal.  (solved)
